intro: Coleogeton, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of Africa, particularly in the eastern and southern parts. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Coleogeton species are often found in grassy areas and can thrive in disturbed soils. They are not commonly cultivated but are occasionally used in traditional medicine.
